maml:description.maml:para: Get an auth key
This operation shows the `cdnAuthKeys` for a specific Akamai `contractId` and specific third-party CDN (`cdnCode`). Auth Keys can be specified when running New-CloudWrapperConfiguration.
The unique identifier Akamai assigned to your contract, where you've added Cloud Wrapper.
The unique identifier Akamai uses for a third-party content delivery network (CDN). Run `Get-CloudWrapperProvider` to get these values.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
The unique identifier Akamai uses for a third-party content delivery network (CDN). Run `Get-CloudWrapperProvider` to get these values.
The unique identifier Akamai assigned to your contract, where you've added Cloud Wrapper.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
List capacity
View the capacities available for a given `contractId`.
A list of contract IDs with Cloud Wrapper entitlement. Run `Get-Contract` from the Akamai.Property module to retrieve these.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A list of contract IDs with Cloud Wrapper entitlement. Run `Get-Contract` from the Akamai.Property module to retrieve these.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get a configuration
View a specific Cloud Wrapper configuration by its ConfigID, or list all existing configurations.
The unique identifier Akamai assigns to your Cloud Wrapper configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
The unique identifier Akamai assigns to your Cloud Wrapper configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

List locations
View the locations available to distribute your Cloud Wrapper capacity. This operation lists the available `trafficTypeId` values for use when creating configurations.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
List origins

View a list of origin servers configured in eligible delivery properties. Response data is pulled from the property as it iss shown in the Property API. At least one origin server entry is shown at the top-level for the `default` rule. If additional origin servers are set in child-level rules in the same property, they're revealed at a lower level.
The unique identifier Akamai assigned to the property you've configured to deliver your media or website content. You can find this with the `Get-Property` command in the Akamai.Property module.
The unique identifier Akamai assigned to your contract, where you've added Cloud Wrapper.
The unique identifier Akamai assigned to the group you used to create the property. You can find this with the `Get-Property` command in the Akamai.Property module.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
The unique identifier Akamai assigned to your contract, where you've added Cloud Wrapper.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
The unique identifier Akamai assigned to the group you used to create the property. You can find this with the `Get-Property` command in the Akamai.Property module.
The unique identifier Akamai assigned to the property you've configured to deliver your media or website content. You can find this with the `Get-Property` command in the Akamai.Property module.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
List properties
View a list of properties for delivery products that are eligible to enable Cloud Wrapper.
A list of contract IDs with Cloud Wrapper entitlement. Run `Get-Contract` from the Akamai.Property module to retrieve these.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Specify whether the response should contain only unused properties.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Specify whether the response should contain only unused properties.
List CDN providers
View a list of CDN providers.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Create a configuration

Create a Cloud Wrapper configuration, either as a JSON string or PSCustomObject, and optionally activate upon creation with the `-Activate` switch. Verify your capacity by viewing your Get-CloudWrapperCapacity, and you can work with your account team to include Cloud Wrapper locations and capacity on your contract.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Specify if you want to activate the modified configuration, `false` by default. You can then run `New-CloudWrapperActivation` separately.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Specify if you want to activate the modified configuration, `false` by default. You can then run `New-CloudWrapperActivation` separately.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Activate a configuration

Activate a Cloud Wrapper configuration. It takes 3-4 hours for the configuration to complete. You can use the configuration's `configId` to run the Get-CloudWrapperConfiguration operation and review its `status`. Once it's `ACTIVE`, enable the Cloud Wrapper behavior in your property. To deactivate a configuration, Set-CloudWrapperConfiguration and add the `-Deactivate` switch.
Array of configuration IDs (which can be piped) or a comma-separated string.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Array of configuration IDs (which can be piped) or a comma-separated string.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Delete a configuration

Delete a specific Cloud Wrapper configuration. The delete can take up to three hours to complete. You can use the configuration's `configId` to run the Get-CloudWrapperConfiguration operation to check the status. `DELETE_IN_PROGRESS` indicates the request has been accepted. A 404 response indicates the configuration has been deleted. Before you delete a configuration, ensure that all the properties that use it have the cloudWrapper behavior disabled. Then Set-CloudWrapperConfiguration the configuration to deactivate it by providing the `-Deactivate` switch.
The unique identifier Akamai assigns to your Cloud Wrapper configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
The unique identifier Akamai assigns to your Cloud Wrapper configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Update a configuration
Update a saved or inactive configuration.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Specify if you want to activate the modified configuration, `false` by default. You can then run `New-CloudWrapperActivation` separately.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
The unique identifier Akamai assigns to your Cloud Wrapper configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
The unique identifier Akamai assigns to your Cloud Wrapper configuration.
Specify if you want to deactivate the configuration, which is required before it can be deleted.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Specify if you want to activate the modified configuration, `false` by default. You can then run `New-CloudWrapperActivation` separately.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
The unique identifier Akamai assigns to your Cloud Wrapper configuration.
Specify if you want to deactivate the configuration, which is required before it can be deleted.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
